incidents.name: Increased latency and errors on the Standard Edge network

incidents.name: Some users aren’t able to access the Netlify management UI, through UK Networks

incident_updates.body: We believe access to our administrative UI should be restored for all customers in all locations.  If you are still seeing trouble reaching only https://app.netlify.com but not sites like https://edge-functions-examples.netlify.app/ , please respond to the post in our forums (https://answers.netlify.com/t/workaround-for-users-who-aren-t-able-to-access-the-netlify-app-through-uk-networks/97047) with details about what network provider you are using, and we'll be happy to help!

We are continuing to work with the relevant providers to resolve this block. More information and workarounds may be found in our forums support guide: https://answers.netlify.com/t/workaround-for-users-who-aren-t-able-to-access-the-netlify-app-through-uk-networks/97047

As of this morning, we’re aware that some customers aren’t able to access the Netlify management UI. It looks like some ISP providers’ DNS Servers started blocking app.netlify.com possibly through router’s Parental Controls. This can be worked around by changing DNS Servers to a third-party like Google (8.8.8.8) or by allowlisting Netlify on the router’s or ISP’s configurations. We are currently working with the upstream provider to fix the invalid categorisation of the domain.

incidents.name: Errors when updating DNS records or zones

incident_updates.body:
Between July 13 22:50 and July 14 00:16 UTC we observed elevated errors returned when attempting to create or update DNS records or zones. If you received an error during this period, you can now attempt to change DNS again.
Actions from automated systems like DNS-based certificate orders will be retried automatically. Answers to DNS queries were not affected at any point.

incidents.name: HTTP 500 errors

incident_updates.body: We've seen full recovery in Lambda functions and AWS reports recovery as well. Our team will continue to monitor but expects no further impact.  Note that in earlier updates on our status page, we had marked our Standard and High-Performance Edge services as impacted in addition to our administrative UI and Lambda Functions.  However, upon review, those services were fully functional for the duration of this outage.
We are seeing vast improvement in correct behavior of lambda functions, and AWS is reporting the same on their status page.  We'll continue to monitor as things develop.
We've largely repaired our administrative UI.  Some sites using lambda functions will still be impacted with HTTP 500 errors.
We believe that the problems in site service are related to a failure in AWS to run lambda functions as mentioned at https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status
We are seeing HTTP 500 errors for some content on our HP Edge and Standard CDN's, mostly around function-backed content.  Our team is investigating.

incidents.name: Delay in processing DNS Records

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved. We are no longer observing errors when updating or creating DNS records in the Netlify UI.

We are monitoring the recovery of our DNS provider's incident. Customer traffic continues to not be impacted and the backlog of DNS record updates are being processed. We will continue to monitor until this incident is fully resolved.

Beginning at 16:45 UTC, our DNS provider began experiencing delays in processing of any DNS record updates. Customer traffic is not impacted at this time, however any changes to DNS records will not be reflected until the issue has been resolved. We will continue monitoring the potential impact to our systems and customer traffic until this incident is resolved.

incidents.name: Asset Optimization Content serving 404

incident_updates.body:
All sites should now be working correctly.

A correction on the previous message: Netlify Forms with file uploads would have completely failed to submit (error 500), so data successfully submitted to Netlify has not been lost.

The team has implemented a fix. The sites should be automatically working without any configuration change from the users' end. We're monitoring the issue closely.

However, form submissions with file uploads would have failed from 10:46 UTC to 14:32 UTC. These files would be irrecoverably lost.

We're investigating some issues with serving asset optimization content. This can include bundled CSS, JS and minified image files. These files would show 404 errors when requested.

Currently, affected users can disable Asset Optimization from site settings and re-deploy.

The team is investigating an issue with logging into Netlify that started at 11:13 UTC.

incidents.name: Go binary installation failure in Netlify Builds

incident_updates.body:
Since December 13, 2022 14:30 UTC, we're seeing errors while installing Go in our build systems across all tiers. This has caused build errors for users trying to rely on Go binaries in their builds, for example, some Hugo builds, or Netlify Functions using Go. Previously deployed sites were not affected. This has been resolved as of December 17 18:28 UTC.

Users that use Go, either the default Go version and created their site on or after November 22, 2022 11:14:34 UTC or manually set their Go version to 1.19.x either via the environment variable GO_VERSION or the file .go-version, were affected.
